Key Match Events: Ecuador went ahead in the 13th minute via a Jamaica own goal, when Piero Hincapie's cross from the left was deflected off Kasey Palmer's shin into the net.
Kendry Paez scored a penalty kick just before the interval after a handball by Gregory Leigh.
Alan Minda scored in the 91st minute with a goal from a classic counter-attack.
Michail Antonio scored Jamaica's first-ever Copa América goal following a corner.
Post-Match Reflections: Ecuador kept their hopes of qualifying for the Copa América quarterfinals alive with a 3-1 win over Jamaica.
Victory gave Ecuador their first points of the tournament and leaves it level with Mexico.
Jamaica is now eliminated following Venezuela's win on Wednesday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: They thought they had earned a penalty themselves in the 73rd minute when referee Cristian Garay was sent to the monitor to check for a possible handball by Alan Franco, but the referee decided not to award a spot kick.
